itemDescription: Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: Iorwerth Jones (3 April 1903 – 31 August 1983) was a Welsh rugby union, and professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1920s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for Wales, and at club level for Llanelli RFC, as a number eight, and club level rugby league (RL) for Leeds.

response: *31 August - Iorwerth Jones, dual-code rugby player, 80
*Iorwerth Jones (1903–1983), Welsh rugby union and professional rugby league footballer
